en.name: Sabang Chocolate Banana Chips
en.description: Chocolate banana chips produced by Cot Bau MSME, Sabang.
en.location: Cot Bau Village, Suka Jaya District, Sabang City
en.detailDescription: This chip is a flagship MSME product supported by the government and Customs, produced in thousands of packs per month as a Pulau Weh specialty snack.

en.name: Sabang Fair View
en.description: Tourist spot with stunning ocean and wave panoramas.
en.detailDescription: A favorite spot for relaxing, taking photos, and enjoying sunsets with a lively atmosphere of vendors and visitors.

en.name: Octopus Satay Pak Ajo
en.description: Legendary octopus satay with a unique taste since the 1980s.
en.location: Perdagangan Road, Kasih Beach & Culinary Tourism Park
en.detailDescription: Octopus meat is marinated in secret spices then grilled until tender, selling thousands of skewers daily as Sabang's culinary icon.

en.name: Sabang Bakpia
en.description: Soft Sabang bakpia with various fillings.
en.detailDescription: Bakpia with flavors from mung bean to coffee and durian, a favorite souvenir for visitors to Sabang.

en.name: Zero Kilometer Fruit Salad
en.description: Signature fruit salad with sweet-spicy palm sugar sauce.
en.detailDescription: Fresh fruit mixed with palm sugar, chili, peanuts, and sago sauce, creating a unique sweet-spicy taste.

en.name: Sabang Noodle Soup
en.description: Signature Pulau Weh noodle soup with fish topping.
en.location: Sejahtera Noodle Soup, Sabang Balohan Road
en.detailDescription: Served boiled or fried with diced fish, bean sprouts, and scallions, popular among tourists.

en.name: Sabang Mie Seudap
en.description: Fresh preservative-free noodles with savory broth.
en.detailDescription: Homemade noodles served with sliced meat and rich chicken broth, a tourist favorite.

en.name: Nyak Lah Acehnese Noodles
en.description: Authentic Acehnese noodles with choice of meat or seafood.
en.detailDescription: Thick yellow noodles cooked with Acehnese spices, popular among locals and tourists.

id.name: Keripik Pisang Coklat Sabang
id.description: Keripik pisang coklat produksi UMKM Cot Bau, Sabang.
id.location: Desa Cot Bau, Kecamatan Suka Jaya, Kota Sabang
id.detailDescription: Keripik ini merupakan produk unggulan UMKM binaan pemerintah dan Bea Cukai, diproduksi ribuan bungkus per bulan sebagai camilan khas Pulau Weh.

id.name: Sabang Fair View
id.description: Spot wisata dengan panorama laut dan ombak indah.
id.detailDescription: Tempat favorit untuk bersantai, berfoto, dan menikmati matahari terbenam dengan suasana ramai pedagang dan wisatawan.

id.name: Sate Gurita Pak Ajo
id.description: Sate gurita legendaris dengan rasa khas sejak 1980-an.
id.location: Jalan Perdagangan, Pantai Kasih & Taman Wisata Kuliner
id.detailDescription: Daging gurita direndam bumbu rahasia lalu dibakar hingga empuk, terjual ribuan tusuk per hari dan jadi ikon kuliner Sabang.

id.name: Bakpia Sabang
id.description: Bakpia lembut khas Sabang dengan isian beragam.
id.detailDescription: Bakpia dengan varian rasa kacang hijau, kopi, hingga durian, jadi oleh-oleh favorit wisatawan dari Sabang.

id.name: Rujak Nol Kilometer
id.description: Rujak buah khas Sabang dengan saus gula aren pedas manis.
id.detailDescription: Perpaduan buah segar dengan saus gula aren, cabai, kacang, dan sagu, menciptakan cita rasa manis pedas yang unik.

id.name: Mie Kocok Sabang
id.description: Mie kocok khas Pulau Weh dengan topping ikan.
id.location: Warung Mie Kocok Sejahtera, Jalan Sabang Balohan
id.detailDescription: Disajikan rebus atau goreng dengan potongan ikan, tauge, dan daun bawang, populer di kalangan wisatawan.

id.name: Mie Seudap Sabang
id.description: Mie segar tanpa pengawet dengan kuah gurih.
id.detailDescription: Mie buatan lokal disajikan dengan irisan daging dan kuah kaldu ayam gurih, jadi salah satu favorit wisatawan.

id.name: Mie Aceh Nyak Lah
id.description: Mie Aceh otentik dengan pilihan daging atau seafood.
id.detailDescription: Mie kuning tebal dimasak dengan bumbu khas Aceh, populer di kalangan lokal dan wisatawan.
